admin.prohibit-different-url-hint: This setting should be enabled for production environments. May cause security issues when disabled
admin.smtp-port-required: You must supply a smtp port.
admin.smtp-port-invalid: That doesn't look like a valid smtp port.
admin.timeout-invalid: That doesn't look like a valid timeout.
admin.proxy-port-range: Proxy port should be in a range from 1 to 65535.
admin.aws-access-key-id-required: AWS Access Key ID is required
admin.aws-secret-access-key-required: AWS Secret Access Key is required
admin.phone-number-hint: Phone Number in E.164 format, ex. +19995550123
admin.phone-number-hint-twilio: Phone Number in E.164 format/Phone Number's SID/Messaging Service SID, ex. +19995550123/PNXXX/MGXXX
admin.phone-number-pattern: Invalid phone number. Should be in E.164 format, ex. +19995550123.
admin.phone-number-pattern-twilio: Invalid phone number. Should be in E.164 format/Phone Number's SID/Messaging Service SID, ex. +19995550123/PNXXX/MGXXX.
admin.sms-message-max-length: SMS message can't be longer 1600 characters
admin.minimum-password-length-range: Minimum password length should be in a range from 5 to 50
admin.minimum-uppercase-letters-range: Minimum number of uppercase letters can't be negative
admin.minimum-lowercase-letters-range: Minimum number of lowercase letters can't be negative
admin.minimum-digits-range: Minimum number of digits can't be negative
admin.minimum-special-characters-range: Minimum number of special characters can't be negative
admin.maximum-password-length-min: Maximum password length should be at least 6
admin.maximum-password-length-less-min: Maximum password length should be greater than minimum length
admin.password-expiration-period-days-range: Password expiration period in days can't be negative
admin.password-reuse-frequency-days-range: Password reuse frequency in days can't be negative
admin.max-failed-login-attempts: Maximum number of failed login attempts, before account is locked
admin.minimum-max-failed-login-attempts-range: Maximum number of failed login attempts can't be negative
admin.user-lockout-notification-email: In case user account lockout, send notification to email
admin.domain-name-unique: Domain name and protocol need to unique.
admin.error-verification-url: A domain name shouldn't contain symbols '/' and ':'. Example: thingsboard.io
admin.force-reset-password-if-no-valid: Force to reset password if not valid
admin.force-reset-password-if-no-valid-hint: Please be careful when enabling this feature: it will require users with not valid password to reset their password via email.

settings.connectivity-settings-hint: Connectivity settings values will be utilized across TBMQ to replace default host/port values on pages: WebSocket Client (add/edit connection), Client Credentials (check connectivity), Home (getting started).
settings.connectivity-hint: If host or port fields are empty, default protocol value will be used.
settings.default-host-port-description: These settings allow you to define default host and port parameters for various protocols utilized throughout the TBMQ system.
settings.port-pattern: Port must be a positive integer.
settings.port-range: Port should be in a range from 1 to 65535.

mqtt-client-credentials.selected-client-credentials: { count, plural, =1 {1 Credentials} other {# Credentials} } selected
mqtt-client-credentials.hint-client-type-application: Use 'Application' type for clients that usually subscribe to topics with high message rates and with the requirement to persist messages when the client is offline, i.e. IoT applications.
mqtt-client-credentials.hint-client-type-device: Use 'Device' type for clients that usually publish a lot of messages, but subscribe to a few topics with low message rate, i.e. IoT devices.
mqtt-client-credentials.hint-credentials-type-basic:
'Basic' is a one-way authentication method based on different combinations of Client ID, Username and/or Password:
  • Client ID - will check if connecting client has specified clientId;
  • Username - will check if connecting client has specified username;
  • Client ID and username- will check if connecting client has both specified clientId and username;
  • Username and password - will check if connecting client has both specified username and password;
  • Client ID and password - will check if connecting client has both specified clientId and password;
  • Client ID, username and password - will check if connecting client has specified clientId, username and password
mqtt-client-credentials.hint-credentials-type-ssl: 'X.509 Certificate Chain' is a secure two-way authentication method over TLS with chain of public-key certificates.
mqtt-client-credentials.hint-ssl-cert-common-name:
Certificate common name (CN) should be exactly the same as the client's or, if present, one of the parent's certificate CN.
Authentication will fail if none of the certificates in the chain has the same CN.
mqtt-client-credentials.hint-ssl-cert-common-name-regex:
Certificate common name (CN) matcher regex should match with the CN of the client's certificate or, if present, one of the parent's certificate CN.
Authentication will fail if none of the certificate CN in the chain match the regex.
mqtt-client-credentials.hint-authorization-ssl:
Authorization rules allow control of topics that authenticated clients are able to publish/subscribe to based on successful combination of:
  • Client certificate CN matcher regex - should match with the CN of the Client certificate.
  • Publish/subscribe authorization rule patterns - allow control of topics that clients with matched Client certificate CN matcher regex
    can publish/subscribe to.
mqtt-client-credentials.hint-authorization-ssl-example:
Please consider the following examples:
  • If the client certificate has CN cn_example_1 - set Client certificate CN matcher regex to cn_example_1 or example_1 or .*example.*.
  • If Publish authorization rule patterns are set as [pub_topic/one/.*, pub_topic/two/.*] - client will be able to publish only
    to the topics that start with pub_topic/one/ or pub_topic/two/.
  • If Subscribe authorization rule patterns are set to the default value [.*] - client will be able to subscribe to any topic.
  • If Publish/Subscribe authorization rules are empty - client will be forbidden to publish/subscribe to any topics.
mqtt-client-credentials.hint-authorization-basic: Authorization rule patterns allow control of topics the clients can publish/subscribe to based on regular expression syntax:
mqtt-client-credentials.hint-regex-patterns:
• Allow particular topic(s) - rule country/.* will allow clients to publish/subscribe only to topics that start with country/.
  • Allow any topic - rule .* (default) will allow clients to publish/subscribe to any topic.
  • Forbid all topics - if the rule is empty, the client is forbidden to publish/subscribe.
mqtt-client-credentials.type-ssl-auth: X.509 Certificate Chain Auth is disabled
mqtt-client-credentials.warning-sub: Empty authorization rule patterns forbid clients to subscribe to any topic.
mqtt-client-credentials.warning-pub: Empty authorization rule patterns forbid clients to publish to any topic.

mqtt-client-session.hint-clean-start-true: This session is not persistent. All info and messages from previous persistent session will be lost after disconnection.
mqtt-client-session.hint-clean-start-false: This session is persistent. All info and messages are stored until the start of clean session.
mqtt-client-session.hint-session-end: When the session info and messages will be removed.
mqtt-client-session.hint-session-expiry-interval: For how long the Client session information is stored after the connection is lost.
mqtt-client-session.session-id-copied-message: Session ID has been copied to clipboard
mqtt-client-session.selected-sessions: { count, plural, =1 {1 Session} other {# Sessions} } selected
mqtt-client-session.selected-sessions-are-connected: Selected Sessions are connected. Please disconnect them before removing.
mqtt-client-session.single-level-wildcards-hint: [+] is suitable for any topic filter level. Ex.: city/+/country or +/city/+/country.
mqtt-client-session.multi-level-wildcards-hint: [#] can replace the topic filter itself and must be the last symbol of the topic filter. Ex.: # or country/city/#.
mqtt-client-session.remove-session-title: Are you sure you want to remove MQTT session for client with ID {{clientId}}?

mqtt-client-session.remove-sessions-title: Are you sure you want to remove { count, plural, =1 {1 Session} other {# Sessions} }?
mqtt-client-session.should-be-persistent-tip: The client is persistent when: MQTT v.3 -> cleanSession=false. MQTT v.5 -> sessionExpiryInterval > 0 or (sessionExpiryInterval = 0 and cleanStart = false).

shared-subscription.selected-shared-subscriptions: { count, plural, =1 {1 Application Shared Subscription} other {# Application Shared Subscriptions} } selected
shared-subscription.name: Name
shared-subscription.hint-application-shared-subscription:
Application Shared Subscriptions are the TBMQ entities used for effective management of the MQTT shared
subscriptions feature. Provision such entities if you plan to use shared subscriptions with Application clients. Read more.
shared-subscription.hint-topic-filter:
The format for a shared subscription topic filter is $share/ShareName/TopicFilter.
If shared subscription topic filter is $share/group1/city/+/home/#, set Topic Filter as city/+/home/#
shared-subscription.hint-partitions:
It is recommended that the number of partitions is equal to or X times more than the expected number of clients of the shared subscription.
For example, if 5 clients are going to be subscribed to the shared subscription, set the Partitions value to 5, 10 or 15.
This will guarantee even load distribution between the subscribers.
shared-subscription.hint-shared-subscription-notes:
Notes:
  • Topic Filter and Partitions fields can not be changed after creation.
  • Application Shared Subscription feature works with MQTT v5 and v3.x

connections.connect-timeout-hint: Time to wait before a CONNACK is received
connections.name: Name
connections.clean-start-hint: Set to false to receive QoS 1 and 2 messages while offline
connections.receive-maximum-hint: The upper limit of unacknowledged 'PUBLISH' messages that the client is capable of handling.
connections.maximum-packet-size-hint: Maximum Packet Size the Client is willing to accept
connections.topic-alias-hint: Value is used to identify the Topic instead of using the Topic Name. Disabled if Topic Alias Max is 0.
connections.topic-alias-error: Topic Alias must be less than the Topic Alias Maximum
connections.topic-alias-maximum-hint: The highest value that the Client will accept as a Topic Alias sent by the Server
connections.reconnect-period-hint: Interval between two reconnections. Disable auto reconnect by setting to 0
connections.request-response-information-hint: The Client uses this value to request the Server to return Response Information in the CONNACK
connections.request-problem-information-hint: The Client uses this value to indicate whether the Reason String or User Properties are sent in the case of failures
connections.reject-unauthorized-hint: If true, client verifies the server certificate chain and host name. Set to false when using a self-signed certificate, but beware of potential man-in-the-middle attacks. Not recommended for production.
connections.url-warning: Your client's host uses HTTPS, but you have selected WS instead of WSS. This could lead to issues with the client's ability to establish a connection.
connections.password-warning: The password is required for the selected Client Credentials.

last-will.payload-format-indicator-hint: True indicates that the payload is UTF-8 Encoded Character Data
last-will.will-delay-interval-hint: The delay of the Last Will message publication after the connection is closed.
last-will.content-type-hint: Describing the content of the payload
last-will.response-topic-hint: The Topic Name for a Response Message
last-will.correlation-data-hint: Used by the sender of the Request Message to identify which request the Response Message is for when it is received

subscriptions.delete-subscription-title: Are you sure you want to delete the subscription with topic filter '{{topic}}'?
subscriptions.delete-subscription-text: Be careful, after the confirmation the subscription with topic filter '{{topic}}' and all related data will become unrecoverable.
subscriptions.rh-hint: Specifies whether retained messages are sent when the subscription is established
subscriptions.nl-hint: If true, Application Messages MUST NOT be forwarded to a connection with a ClientID equal to the ClientID of the publishing connection
subscriptions.rap-hint: If true, Application Messages forwarded using this subscription keep the RETAIN flag they were published with. If false, Application Messages forwarded using this subscription have the RETAIN flag set to 0.
subscriptions.subscription-identifier-hint: When a message is published that matches the subscription, the server sends the subscription identifier in the message, enabling the client to identify the subscription that the message was matched against.

js-func.return-type-mismatch: Function must return value of '{{type}}' type!

2fa.2fa-description: Two-factor authentication protects your account from unauthorized access. All you have to do is enter a security code when you log in.
2fa.disable-2fa-provider-text: Disabling {{name}} will make your account less secure
2fa.disable-2fa-provider-title: Are you sure you want to disable {{name}}?
2fa.main-2fa-method: Use as main two-factor authentication method

dialog.activation-step-description-email: The next time you login in, you will be prompted to enter the security code that will be sent to your email address.
dialog.activation-step-description-sms: The next time you login in, you will be prompted to enter the security code that will be sent to the phone number.
dialog.activation-step-description-totp: The next time you login in, you will need to provide a two-factor authentication code.
dialog.backup-code-description: Print out the codes so you have them handy when you need to use them to log in to your account. You can use each backup code once.
dialog.backup-code-warn: Once you leave this page, these codes cannot be shown again. Store them safely using the options below.
dialog.email-step-description: Enter an email to use as your authenticator.
dialog.scan-qr-code: Scan this QR code with your verification app
dialog.sms-step-description: Enter a phone number to use as your authenticator.
dialog.totp-step-description-install: You can install apps like Google Authenticator, Authy, or Duo.
dialog.totp-step-description-open: Open the authenticator app on your mobile phone.
dialog.verification-code-many-request: Too many requests check verification code
dialog.verification-step-description: Enter a 6-digit code we just sent to {{address}}

provider.email-description: Use a security code sent to your email address to authenticate.
provider.email-hint: Authentication codes are sent via email to {{ info }}
provider.sms-description: Use your phone to authenticate. We'll send you a security code via SMS message when you log in.
provider.sms-hint: Authentication codes are sent by text message to {{ info }}
provider.totp-description: Use apps like Google Authenticator, Authy, or Duo on your phone to authenticate. It will generate a security code for logging in.
provider.totp-hint: Authenticator app is set up for your account
provider.backup-code-description: These printable one-time passcodes allow you to sign in when away from your phone, like when you’re traveling.
provider.backup-code-hint: {{ info }} single-use codes are active at this time
